channel.title: I need a website idea
channel.description:
I have pretty good knowledge of everything required to make a website, but what I lack is a theme and idea, and I really want to have my own website, whether it be for personal use, or a community project. I'd love a good idea, or criticism about the following possibilities.
My first idea was just a general website for my projects/games with a little blog, which I already have made, but nothing about it is unique, so it's boring. Maybe if I could get a unique layout idea or other fun ways to make it, I'd make the website more advanced.
Then, today I had the idea to allow a community to upload songs to the website, and let people listen to that music for free(not allow downloading of the songs). I'm not sure if this has been done, how hard it would be to not allow illegal downloading, or if it's legal, but it sounds interesting.
Another possible idea would be a website that is linked to a flash/java game, so it can show the players online, have a highscore table, and all those features. It would be a simple, small game at first since it's more about the features of the website, but then it could be made into something bigger maybe.
Any other fun ideas or criticism of my approach or ideas would be greatly appreciated, I know I have the ability to make a good website, and I find it fun, but I lack in the ability to come up with ideas that I can stick with.

item.title: I need a website idea
item.dc:creator: @fellixombc fellixombc
item.description:
@fellixombc wrote:

Heres an old trick to have music on your website shared as long it follows the below statement.

Here it is:

"Copyright Disclaimer Under Section 107 of the Copyright Act 1976, allowance is made for "fair use" for purposes such as criticism, comment, news reporting, teaching, scholarship, and research. Fair use is a use permitted by copyright statute that might otherwise be infringing. Non-profit, educational or personal use tips the balance in favor of fair use."

Read full topic

item.title: I need a website idea
item.dc:creator: @Tenac Tenac
item.description:
@Tenac wrote:

Unhandled:

silverlight bro, it’s some cool stuff.

I see no reason to choose Silverlight over Flash, especially with all my Flash knowledge.

I still think my music idea could go somewhere if it isn’t illegal.

Read full topic

item.title: I need a website idea
item.dc:creator: @Tenac Tenac
item.description:
@Tenac wrote:

inertia:

Feel free to check your messages at any time

Sorry for taking so long, I was away from the computer for a while.

And on a side note to my main question, if my website is linked to a web browser game, would it be challenging to make the game secure to prevent any cheating? I’m totally against online web browser games, but if I were to make a serious one, what language should it be; java, flash, or other? I’d prefer C++ outside of a web browser haha.

Read full topic

item.title: I need a website idea
item.dc:creator: @inertia inertia
item.description:
@inertia wrote:

Feel free to check your messages at any time

Read full topic

item.title: I need a website idea
item.dc:creator: @Tenac Tenac
item.description:
@Tenac wrote:

Well, profit isn’t really on my mind, and making a generic blog doesn’t sound very fun and I’d never use that, and the portfolio idea I’ve already done, but it’s too boring and without a little uniqueness, I don’t feel like improving it.

I still am curious if my music uploader/listener is possible and legal, and if there could be other fun, community based ideas like that.

Read full topic

item.title: I need a website idea
item.dc:creator: @Zero_Freeze ZeroFreeze
item.description:
@Zero_Freeze wrote:

Well it depends on what you want to achieve with your website.

Do you want to generate a bit of passive income from advertisements and players playing your game?
Do you want to have users reading your blog articles / having discussions about them?
Do you want to showcase your projects or whatever in a portfolio-kind of thing?

Read full topic
